meaningMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>divide</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to divide</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to split something</vocabulary>.

It can also mean <vocabulary>to break something</vocabulary>, as in ワイングラスを割る (to break a wine glass). After all, you’re technically dividing the object into parts if you break it, right?
readingMnemonic: The reading you learned with the kanji is the one you'll use here. It's the わ one, though, making it わる.
